message: Hi Bob, I'm excited to offer you a chance to purchase my product. Given its value, I'm initially proposing a price of $11,500. I'm confident this is a fair price that reflects the true worth of what's being offered.
I appreciate your initial offer, but I was thinking more along the lines of $10,000. I'm willing to pay that price for the product.
Bob, I understand your perspective, but $10,000 is significantly below its true value. I'm willing to negotiate, so how about we meet in the middle at $11,000?
I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, but I'm still thinking $10,000 is a fair price. I'm not willing to go above that.

Bob, I'm sensing some hesitation on your end. While I'm firm on the product's value, I'm open to a final offer. Would you be willing to meet me at $10,500? This allows me to make a fair deal while acknowledging your position.
I appreciate your flexibility, but I'm still thinking $10,000 is the best price for me. I'm not willing to go above that.
